Comment 1: 
Actually it's the same way in all languages that does that kinda thing, aka using
closures inside loops.

The usual way to do it is to pass the variable to the closure like :

for _, u := range urls {
        go func(u string){
            Crawl(ubuff, depth-1, fetcher)
            waiter<-true //finished
        }(u)
        waitcount++
    }
